intro: Urena monopetala, commonly known as the one-petaled urena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Urena monopetala is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
